data.system_settings: Windows 10 Pro x64 Build v1803 and Nexus 5x Android 8.1.0
data.actual_result: Your phone gets the notification but it becomes instantly read, so you don't know what the other user says until you go into Discord
data.expected_result: You should get your messages and they should stay as push notifications in your notification bar
data.short_description: Notifications being instantly read on Desktop even when you are AFK for a set amount of time
data.steps_to_repro: - Have one phone and one computer, both signed into the same Discord account - Go to your desktop client and to your User Settings - Go to Notifications and set your "Push Notification AFK Timer" to 3 minutes (this might work with other times as well) - Talk in a person's DMs make sure it's a conversation that will continue on - Leave Discord on your friend's DM - Go AFK from your computer, bringing your phone with you (side note: make sure your computer doesn't auto sleep/shutdown in your OS Settings) - Make sure your friend is still sending you messages for a couple of minutes
